subject: physics
question_html: A quantity X is given by $${\varepsilon _0}L{{\Delta V} \over {\Delta t}}$$ where $${\varepsilon _0}$$ is the permittivity of the free space, L is a length, $${\Delta V}$$ is a potential difference and $${\Delta t}$$ is a time interval. The dimentional formula for X is the same as that of

options.label: a
options.html:
A
resistance

options.label: b
options.html:
B
charge

options.label: c
options.html:
C
voltage

options.label: d
options.html:
D
current

explanation_html:
Given that $$X = {\varepsilon _0}L\left( {{{\Delta V} \over {\Delta t}}} \right)$$

Therefore, dimensional formula for X is

$$[{M^{ - 1}}{L^{ - 3}}{T^4}{I^2}][L]{{[M{L^2}{T^{ - 3}}{I^{ - 1}}]} \over {[T]}} = [I]$$

Thus, dimensional formula for X is same as that of current.

Answer (D)
